PanamaData.1: Actors Guardia Nacional,The work of the Comisión de la Verdad reports 110 cases of victims of state violence that were investigated and documented
Key historical events
1968 – On October 11
1969 – General Omar Torrijos took control of the government.
1970 – Union leader Heliodoro Portugal was detained by the armed forces
1971 – Colombian priest Jesús Héctor Gallego was kidnaped in the Veraguas province by members of the Guardia Nacional. He was then killed and forcibly disappeared.
1977 – A delegation from the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights visited Panama. A report on human rights situation was produced in 1978.
1981 – General Torrijos died in an accident.
1983 – Manuel Antonio Noriega took control of the armed forces and de facto control of the government. The Guardia Nacional became the Fuerzas de Defensa
1985 – Physician and guerrilla Hugo Spadafora was tortured
1987 – Mass protests against the Noriega regime occured in Panama. The organisation known as Cruzada Civilista led the calls to protest
1989 – Albrook Massacre. Sectors of the armed forces attempted a coup against Noriega. The leaders of the uprising were subsequently tortured and killed.
1989 – On December 20
Noriega was captured by U.S. forces and prosecuted abroad for drug trafficking.
1989 – While Panama was still under U.S. occupation
Memory initiatives
Informe de la Comisión de la Verdad de Panamá. “…la Verdad os hará libres” (2002): document detailing the work of the commission
https://www.defensoria.gob.pa/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/Informe-de-la-Comision-de-la-Verdad.pdf
Case Heliodoro Portugal versus Panama (2008). After a long judicial process
Friendly settlements in Case 13
Case 13017 A – Between the Panamanian state and the COFADEPA-HG
Case 13017 C – Between the Panamanian state and the COFADECHI
Sites of memory
Cuartel Los Pumas: barracks located in the Tocumen neighbourhood
Organisations
Comité Panameño por los Derechos Humanos (CPDH): an organisation active since 1987
Coordinadora Popular de Derechos Humanos de Panamá (COPODEHUPA): a civil organisation founded in 1986 with the aim of providing support in cases of human rights violations.
Comité de Familiares de Asesinados y Desaparecidos de Panamá “Héctor Gallego” (COFADEPA)
Comisión de la Verdad: A body created in 2001 at the behest of various civil organisations
Comisión 20 de Diciembre 1989: A commission created via an Executive Order in 2016 with the aim of investigating human rights violations that occurred during the U.S. invasion of Panama.
Issues specific to the country
The United States government was heavily involved in Panamanian politics
